content.description: Climb an easy alcove up to a huge ledge.(rap anchor). from here,traverse out right to a dihedral on an arete.(1 bolt) About halfway up the pitch, step left out on to the face,(another bolt) and continue up the arete. Climb past 3 more bolts up a fun and exposed face to the anchor. Rap off to the climber's right.
content.protection: 6 draws and a single rack to #2 Camalot . Rap down the wall on right side of the climb; directly below the anchor. 70m rope.
content.location: Follow hiking directions for PSOM slabs.

content.description: Sustained, technical face climbing starts at a low bolt and bypasses a bulge on the left.  Trend slightly left to a technical headwall.
content.location: This route starts ~150 feet uphill (looker's right) from Watchtower. It is the first bolted line uphill from Watchtower.

content.description: This route is mostly a 5.6 dihedral, perfect for a starting leader. The climb starts on a dihedral slab that goes through a small roof down low at the 2nd bolt.(5.9) A few more slab moves get you to a great stance and easier terrain. Climb a beautiful 5.6 dihedral til it pinches off. Step out left and follow easy face (5.2)? past a bolt to the summit of Sweetie pillar. 2 raps with a 70m rope.
content.protection: 5 draws and a single rack up to #2 Camalot. Bring a few extra cams if your a newer leader. It's a long pitch.
content.location:
Follow hiking directions for PSOM slabs. Fork left just before reaching the toe of the PSOM buttress. Watchtower is on the next buttress directly left of PSOM buttress, and Sweetie is just uphill from that.

Also just uphill from Gold Wall.

content.description: From the base, boulder up a short section with optional protection that leads up and over easy 5th class to a sloping ledge at the base of a corner. An initial layback move gains the corner, which requires creative stemming and layback climbing, to a good rest just under a roof/visor. Boulder out under the roof, traversing through a series of technical moves, using pockets, and a horizontal crack/seam to a mantle at the end.
content.protection: Pro: 8 bolts and gear from purple metolius equivalant, to .75 Camelot and optional stoppers. Lower off with 70 m rope. NOTE: Super tradsters, in order to protect vital holds(for me at least), please refrain from putting in gear and bypassing the bolts in last 3rd of traverse as this was attempted on the FA resulting in a couple of broken edges along the horizontal crack/seam. Thanks.
content.location: Follow the PSOM trail to just about the toe of the PSOM buttress. A faint "cut off" trail makes a sharp left. Go up a short ways over easy talus and connect with a trail that leads to the base of the Gold Wall. Head up another 20 yards or so to the base of Sun Kissed. The climb is just left of Red to Riches and the prolific Austin Loves Dragons.

content.description: Start at two right leaning hand cracks. Boulder up into cracks and traverse up and right in a cool double crack system (cams) .At first bolt, step directly left; then follow 6 more bolts, up through the thin flake system. alternatively; There is a short Rt. facing dihedral just right of the flake (3rd bolt?);that can be done  with some small cams or stoppers.5.8
content.protection:
A few pieces from .5 Camalot to #2, at the bottom.

7 Bolts to the top. Rap anchor at top. Shares anchor with Watchtower.
content.location: This route is between Watchtower and Touch of gray on the North facing wall, across the gully from Gold Wall.You'll see the double cracks that start the route on your left as you walk up the Gold Wall gully.

content.description: The steepest hand crack in Pine Creek, too bad itâ€™s only 45 feet long.
content.location: This starts uphill from After the Gold Rush and is approached by low angle but slippery slabs uphill and left of "Sweetie." Located farther uphill than all other routes, and can not be seen until even with the start of the climb.

content.description:
The left-most climb on the Gold Wall.

Climb up a short crack and work right and up to the top of the red wall. A reachy crux is harder for short folks. Finish on a nice layback and touchy slab.
content.location: This is the furthest left route on the Gold Wall.

content.description: Use the crack to get to the first bolt. Climb funky moves to a large crack and then finish on a tricky move to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a bolted hook anchor.
content.location: Starts on the large ledge towards the right of the Gold Wall.

content.description: A great climb up the center of the Gold Wall. Well protected and fun. A little cryptic as most of the holds face the wrong ways. Fun climbing here!
content.protection: 11 bolts to a bolted hook anchor.
content.location: Center route on the Gold Wall.

content.description: Climb the crack on the right side of the Gold Wall merging with "Pot of Gold" near the top.
content.location: Right most climb on the Gold Wall.

content.description: This is on the same side of the gully as The Gold Wall. It's the next flank of rock just uphill. Climb a narrow left facing corner/ramp to a nice ledge. Stay right here (better protection). Follow cracks up a ways to another great stance. From here thin cams will get you to a single bolt in between cracks. Climb past bolt to finger crack that turns to a pod/alcove.(crux 5.10) Then a thin hand crack takes you to the anchor.
content.protection: 1 bolt, and a double rack of small to #1 Camalot will do it. Take a #2 Camalot for the ramp down low.
content.location: Follow hiking directions for PSOM slabs. Fork left just before reaching the toe of the PSOM buttress.  It is located just above the big gold and orange walls on the R hand side of the gully.

content.description: Start off the block ledge on the left side of the Gold Wall. Technical climbing leads to a walk the plank ledge and a reachy crux move on nice holds. Finish on a tricky slab. Shares the anchors with "Orange Crush".
content.location: The left climb on the main face of the Gold Wall. Fourth from the right.

content.description: Left of Red to Riches. Bolt line gradually traverses left, then follow the slab to a fun roof. Crux at the 3rd bolt, tricky climbing, once you figure it out it's not that bad.
content.protection: 6 bolts, optional small nut to protect the final move.
content.location: Left of Red to Riches, Shares the same anchors.

content.description: A steep start leads to enjoyable face climbing and a large recess.  A dynamic move getting out of the recess is the crux.
content.location: Third bolted route uphill from Watchtower.Starts on the wall across from "Freescale Semiconductor."

content.description: Lie back the left side of a pillar. Gain the notch between the pillar and the wall, and surmount the pillar. Step across notch to clip bolt and gain the slab. Follow bolts up the slab and left to a large roof. Pull roof and head up to the next smaller roof with double dihedrals. Climb up and through to the mantle just before the anchors.
content.protection: 13 bolts. Lower off. About halfway down the lower off, head around the corner to the climber's left, and lower into the gully.
content.location: This route is 75 feet left of The Watchtower. Look for the pillar leaning against the face.
